page.title: 01The Appeal of Wendover
page.content: Wendover is a fair sized village at the foot of the Chiltern Hills. It is on the main road from Aylesbury to London, although a bypass is to be built in 1988. There are lovely places to walk including Coombe Hill, from where you can clearly see Wendover and the beechy Halton Woods. The famous Ridgeway Path runs through the village centre. A visit to the Tourist Information Office in the Clock Tower would be a good idea. There are lots of places to eat and drink and plenty of amenities and clubs. There are quite a few churches in Wendover, the oldest being the Parish Church of St.Mary. Wendover is quite an advanced village, although shopping is fairly limited.
